title: Teen Drivers Targeted As Police Ramp Up Traffic Enforcement In Haddonfield
description: Police will target key areas of town for speeding and traffic violations. Here's where.
content:
HADDONFIELD, NJ — Haddonfield police plan to ramp up traffic enforcement in an effort to get teenagers to drive more safely.

Officers are targeting key areas of town to monitor speeding and other traffic violations as part of the new "Smart Choices Behind the Wheel" campaign. Although the campaign is designed around teen drivers, any driver can be ticketed for violations. Starting this week, Haddonfield police will increase traffic enforcement on sections of Grove Street, Wood Lane, West End Avenue, Washington Avenue and Chews Landing Road.

Haddonfield police informed student drivers and their parents about the campaign in a letter last week, which the department shared Wednesday on social media. "Please speak with your teen driver today," said the letter from Police Chief Jason Cutler and Borough Commissioner Frank Troy. "Your voice matters. Reinforce the importance of staying focused, avoiding distractions, maintaining safe following distances, obeying traffic signs and signals, and practicing patience and courtesy behind the wheel."
summary: The Haddonfield police are increasing traffic enforcement in an effort to encourage teenagers to drive more safely. The "Smart Choices Behind the Wheel" campaign will focus on speeding, other traffic violations and educating the public about the dangers of driving. Although the campaign is primarily aimed at teenagers, any vehicle can be ticketed for these violations. The police have informed student drivers and their parents about the campaign in a letter sent out last week.
shortSummary: Haddonfield police will increase traffic enforcement to encourage more than 20,000 teenagers to drive safely, focusing on areas like Northampton and Gloucester.

argos_summary: Haddonfield police are intensifying traffic enforcement to improve teen driver safety, targeting speeding and other violations on key streets such as Grove Street and West End Avenue. The initiative, called "Smart Choices Behind the Wheel," includes a campaign letter to students and parents urging safer driving habits. Enforcement will be increased starting this week across several town sections.
